intro: Satureja connata, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are aromatic, often used in traditional medicine and cuisine for their pungent, savory flavor. Satureja connata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
